result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Emerson Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today October 13, 2015 by 11:45 a.m.
Defendant is entitled to 8 days credit under 973.155.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested by Agent and follow all recommendations.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Domestice Abuse Assessment within 30 days and follow all recommendations of Agent.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as directed by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Mrs. Sheffel.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain employment.
-Appear in Court on November 17, 2015.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow all recommendations of Agent.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Matthew L Hartung   DF:  Devon Emerson Bryant appeared. Includes 15CT115, 15CM263, 15CM499. Case called at 10:57 am. ADA Hartung recites agreement. No objection from Atty Smestad. Court amends 15CT115 to OWI 1st without a child in vehicle and amends 15CM263 to Disorderly Conduct without Domestic Abuse Enhancer.  Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one in 15CT115 and amended count one in 15CM263, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of amended count one in 15CT115 and amended count one in 15CM263. Court dismisses count one in 15CM499 without prejudice and count two with prejudice. Count two in 15CT115 is also dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguements. Defendant makes statement. On 15CM263, court orders: 1 yr probation w/h
- 45 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs $114.50
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- AODA
- Domestic Abuse Assessment
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- No Abusive Contact with Mrs. Scheffel
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Maintain Employment
- Appear in court on 11/17/2015
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation by 10/13/2015
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent

Credit for 8 days

On 15CT115, court orders - F/F $761.00 6 month rev, credit for admistrative suspension, no IID, AODA

Bond on file.

Includes 15CM499, 15CM263 & 15CT115

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Ms. Sheffel.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
